title: Scarlett Moffatt she gets into a VERY heated row while celebrating her 29th birthday
text:
Scarlett Moffatt has been spotted screaming that another reveller was 'f***ing laughing at [her]' while she celebrated her 29th birthday in London on Saturday.

The Beauty School Cop Outs star, whose birthday falls on Thursday, was caught on camera losing her cool while partying at an east London bingo hall.

In footage obtained by The Sun, she appears to be demanding that the person in question be ejected from the club as she screeches: 'He’s not good? He’s not good She’s f***ing laughing at me. This is my birthday. She’s laughing at me, man.'

Row: Scarlett Moffatt has been spotted screaming that another reveller was 'f***ing laughing at [her]' while she celebrated her 29th birthday in London on Saturday

The former Gogglebox star made her way to Shoreditch's hip Dabbers with her policeman boyfriend Scott Dobinson and TOWIE star James Argent, as well as a selection of some of her closest friends.

But things soon went from celebratory to furious when Scarlett found herself at loggerheads with another partygoer.

A source told The Sun: 'Scarlett was in good spirits and looking forward to enjoying her birthday. She had a big group with her and it seemed nothing could dampen her mood.

We like to party: Hours before getting into the row, Scarlett shared a snapshot of herself and pals as they prepared to party the night away in east London

But it all kicked off later in the night and Scarlett was left feeling uncomfortable at her own bash. Her outburst may have shocked people used to seeing her laughing and joking on the telly. But it was clear she had become distressed.'

Seemingly alluding to the shocking showdown, Scarlett shared a post on Instagram on Sunday that read: 'Your friends should speak up for you when you feel low. If they don’t, dump them'

Personalising the message, she added: 'Feel really lucky going into my 29th chapter of life with supportive friends, family & boyfriend. It's hard sometimes letting people go but it's important for your mental health.'

MailOnline has contacted a representative for Scarlett Moffatt for comment.

Hinting? Seemingly alluding to the showdown, Scarlett shared a post on Instagram on Sunday

Before the row, Scarlett took to her Instagram account to share a shot of herself ready to hit the town with her pals for her celebrations.

Captioning the image, she wrote: 'Turning 29 with my favourites the girls I lived with at uni, my besties from home, my family, only missing a couple but so happy!!

'Let’s make this last year of my 20s the best!! Life is far too important to take sensibly remember that everybody!! #birthday #love #friends #family.'

She stepped out in style for the occasion, donning a denim jacket with jeans, which she teamed with a white blouse and towering striped heels.

Nearest and dearest: Scarlett partied with a large group of loved ones that included her policeman boyfriend Scott Dobinson and TOWIE star James Argent

Sporting a generous application of makeup, the bubbly TV personality doorknocker earrings, while she wore her dark tresses in a sleek ponytail.

Earlier in the week, Scarlett, whose weight has famously fluctuated over the years, spoke to New! Magazine about her figure and while she admitted she is confident within herself, she will 'never be perfect or truly happy'

Scarlett was opening up about how she deals with body image and confesses she is finally feeling better about herself.

Speaking to the magazine, she said: 'I've been lots of different shapes and sizes but I feel like now I'm just really happy in myself and I think that reflects on the outside...

Snap: By Sunday afternoon, she appeared to have moved on from the row as she shared selfies

'I'm not pretending that I'm the perfect body shape. I've got boobs and hips and rather than try and cover them up, I'm embracing them. I'm trying to show them off a bit more.

Scarlett recently revealed that she privately messages body shamers on social media to ask if they’re okay as she discusses how she tackles negative criticism.

The former Gogglebox star also stated that ‘the world would be a boring place if we all looked the same’ as she launches her new, inclusive Scarlett Loves Peacock edit.

After soaring to fame on the Channel 4 show alongside her family, Scarlett has gone on to become a household name, having starred on huge shows including I’m A Celebrity, Saturday Night Takeaway and Streetmate.

Pressed: On Sunday night, she shared footage of her beau Scott Dobinson ironing, ahead of them going on vacation to continue celebrating her birthday

But with newfound fame comes naysayers, with the County Durham native having sadly faced her fair share of internet trolls and body shamers.

Acceptance: Last week, the TV personality proudly admitted she is 'finally body confident'

‘So, a couple of times I have actually messaged people and said, “are you okay?” and every time I’ve done that, they’ve always messaged back and said, “I’m so sorry!” So hopefully they learn from it.’

Pointing out the downside to her bold actions, she added: ‘Unfortunately, you can’t spend all your time messaging people asking if they’re alright!’

It’s not just Scarlett who has her own way of coping with the criticism, her mother Betty also has a tried and tested method of releasing her anger when her daughter is trolled.

‘My mum will write out her response to the trolls but will never actually post it, she just deletes it!’ she explained. ‘She’s always like “I just want to press send!” and I’m like “you can’t! It would be everywhere; you can’t press send!”
